result.markdown: --- title: "Content" --- The course content is divided in chapters: for each topic, readers have access to course notes, sample code, online quizzes and exercises. ## Course notes - [Basics of statistical inference](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/intro.html) - [Linear regression](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/linear-regression.html) - [Generalized linear models](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/generalized-linear-models.html) - [Correlated and longitudinal data](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/correlated-longitudinal-data.html) - [Linear mixed models](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/linear-mixed-models.html) - [Survival analysis](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/survival.html) - [Likelihood](https://lbelzile.github.io/math60604a/likelihood.html) ## Videos and Slides In this section you can find the links to all videos individually as well as the slides and accompanying code used in the videos. ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} |S |Content | Slides | PDF | Videos | SAS | R | ::: ::: --- ## Data The **SAS** databases (`.sas7bdat`) can be downloaded [by clicking on this link](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lbelzile/statmod/main/datasets/MATH60604A_SAS_data.zip). Create a repository on SAS onDemand, add these files and create a library as shown in the Introduction to SAS. To access the course database, you can also add the following code snippet in your **SAS** autoload: `LIBNAME statmod "~/my_shared_file_links/u41148888/statmod" access=readonly;` You must create a local copy to modify these data. You can also access the data sets in **R** by installing the `hecstatmod` package from Github using the following commands (uncomment the first line to install the `remotes` and `learnr` libraries - do only once): ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #install.packages(c("learnr","remotes")) remotes::install_github("lbelzile/hecstatmod") ``` ::: *Note*: not all data sets are currently documented and (most) tutorials are still missing. Please re-install the package periodically to benefit from the latest features. ## Quiz The **R** package also contain quizzes: to run the later and launch a new browser window, use the following commands (each line represents a different quiz). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} learnr::run_tutorial("intro", package = "hecstatmod") learnr::run_tutorial("likelihood", package = "hecstatmod") ``` :::
